author: solbster
body:
# Steps to reproduce

Restart-Computer -ComputerName myServer -Wait -For PowerShell -Force

# Expected behavior

Restart-Computer should complete waiting for PowerShell when it comes avaible after restart.

# Actual behavior

Restart-Computer never completes. 

# Additional
Restart-Computer -ComputerName myServer -Wait -For WinRM -Force   (this works as expected)

# Environment data

PSVersion                                 7.1.0-preview.1
PSEdition                                  Core
GitCommitId                             7.1.0-preview.1
OS                                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.18362
Platform                                    Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions              {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion     2.3
SerializationVersion                  1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion                 3.0

# Edit

Did some more testing and it seem to be a problem for previous versions also.

comments.author: TheDotSource
comments.body: Found my way here after experiencing the same issue. Testing a previously working workflow and it hung at Restart-Computer, waiting for PowerShell which never completes. Same command from/to the same systems works as expected at a 5.1 prompt.

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body: At a guess, @PaulHigin might have some familiarity with how this is supposed to work / what might be going wrong here? 🤔

comments.author: PaulHigin
comments.body: I'm not familiar with this code very much.  But I believe @daxian-dbw has some experience with it, and may be able to provide more information.

comments.author: doctordns
comments.body: This has been an issue for many many years, and occurs in Windows PowerShell. It _seems_ like it only happens the first time you attempt to remotely restart a system and wait for PowerShell. I found just rebooting manually then restarting the script after the reboot point works.

comments.author: MathieuBerthe
comments.body:
I have the same almost behavior but randomly the Restart-Computer return an error "Restarting the computer did not finish within the time limit." The computer has restarted and PowerShell is ready.

comments.author: doctordns
comments.body: By 'randomly' do you mean the first time you try this after installing the OS?

comments.author: MathieuBerthe
comments.body:
Hello,
@doctordns, no, it's really random.
Each week end I reboot 2 times all Remote Desktop Session servers because I have an issue with FSLogix and for apply updates.
Sometimes, I have no issue with Restart-Computer and another weekend, I can have 10% of failed Restart-Computer.

comments.author: doctordns
comments.body:
I have seen a server not reboot property when the server has just been installed (in a VM) and this is the first restart-computer command issued against that server. In my testing this happened 10-15% of the time - but thereafter the reboots worked flawlessly.  In my testing of 7.1/7.2 as they evolved - I cannot recall this happening here.

I would second @iSazonov point - this is probably a dup of #11002
